text:
decreased in RPS versus control groups by 5.5 ppt ( 39). A 
significant change in underweight was also reported; it decreased in RPS areas (13.7% to 
9.8%) while it increased in control areas (14.3% to 16.6%). Compared to national averages 
for this time period, the prevalence of underweight was much higher in both RPS and 
control areas. The cash transfer may have a greater impact in these rural, poor areas in times 
of economic and environmental hardship. 
Atención a Crisis ran from 2005–2006
